thread.title: Ex-pensions minister stays on message with Royal London
thread.title_full: Ex-pensions minister stays on message with Royal London

title: Ex-pensions minister stays on message with Royal London
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Ex-pensions minister stays on message with Royal London Steve Webb earned the respect of industry for his understanding of pensions Danny lawson/PA Patrick Hosking Financial Editor Last updated at 12:01AM, August 13 2015 
Steve Webb is to join the pensions and life assurance company Royal London six months after losing his government job after the general election. 
Royal London yesterday named the former pensions minister in a newly created role of director of policy and external communications. 
He will join on November 9, the earliest allowed by the Advisory Committee on Business Appointments, the Cabinet Office body that polices moves to the private sector by ministers and civil servants. The committee has also banned Mr Webb from directly lobbying on behalf of Royal for another two years after his appointment. 
Acoba vets private
